website_summaries.verdict: Application to clothing can be challenging, but the results speak for themselves. Highly recommended for hunters, hikers, and campers. Not for use on skin.
pros: Very effective against disease-carrying mosquitoes and ticks
cons: Some complaints about the pump sprayer
Active ingredient not safe for cats

customer_reviews.title: TICKS FALL RIGHT OFF
customer_reviews.text: A few days ago I sprayed my pants from the knee down and from the crotch up with Sawyer Permethrin—a bug/tick repellant. Said to last for six weeks and through as many washings. (It’s routinely used by the U.S. Army .) . Coming back this morning from our pre-breakfast walk with the dog, I spotted a deer tick (the dangerous tiny ones) ankle high on my pants. It can have been on me for no more than 10 minutes. . The little bugger seemed not to know which way to crawl. It flipped over 2 or 3 times and then fell off. Himm, now that’s what I call anti-tick power.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Holzel

customer_reviews.title: No Bug Allowed
customer_reviews.text: I treated some hiking pants and shirts with this product. Hiked over 300 miles on the Appalachian Trail without a bug problem. Even rained 1/2 the time and stayed bug free. I will treat my clothes again this year. I this I even sprayed my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: SPRAY DEVICE FAILS AFTER 2 USES-- So you can't apply this to your clothing. USELESS.
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Whether or not this product repels insects is immaterial if the NOZZLE and SPRAY device DON'T WORK. I have seen other reviews that spoke of the same poor quality of the spray nozzle-- but I didn't think it was a widespread issue. Now, I see it is.... This is the second time I used this bottle-- the first time, the spray was weak.... the second time, the spray device didn't work at all. Little drops came out and fell straight down from the spray nozzle. I adjusted, tightened, readjusted, etc, but ended up with it on my hands, but not on my clothing.
customer_reviews.author: doublezd

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase unless manufacturer ships with a bottle and sprayer that fits and works properly.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 bottles of this product to treat a number of garments for a trip to India. Unfortunately, the trigger sprayer did not properly fit the bottle. While applying the product the sprayer kept popping off the bottle, thus the bottle dropped onto the ground, splashing onto my shoes and pants and spilling the chemical. It was a struggle to finish spraying my garments after just one bottle, trying to hold the sprayer on the bottle. I am returning the remaining 3 bottles and looking for another product that will be easier to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin P

customer_reviews.title: Much more convenient than spraying Deet every day
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say whether it works excellent vs. good enough, but the convenience of spraying clothes once before a mission trip and worrying less about having a Deet based spray with you when you come across mosquitoes is why I like it. Also, there is some concern about absorbing the Deet and it's just a tad sticky. It is key to spray and let clothes dry at least overnight, better yet 24-48 hours (smells like gasoline) but the smell does amazingly vanish and is not an issue after drying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TICKS are gone
customer_reviews.text: We live in NE PA and the ticks are HORRIBLE this year. Every time my husband would go out in the back yard or near our woods - he always came back with ticks. He's used this twice this year and NO ticks! Would highly recommend it. Not for use on animals - just your shoes and clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Prissy

customer_reviews.title: You'd better have your own quality trigger sprayer ready to transfer ...
customer_reviews.text: You'd better have your own quality trigger sprayer ready to transfer the permethrin into. The trigger sprayer that comes with it is a joke. Useless! Not even made for the bottle it comes with. Sawyer really cheaped out and included the CHEAPEST sprayer they could find. You will see exactly what I mean if you make the mistake of buying it.
customer_reviews.author: RIL

customer_reviews.title: Easy Use & No Heavy Pesticides
customer_reviews.text: Why ask in review- Flavor, Lord do not taste this stuff? All I know is tried this stuff on those ants huddling upon their prey. One squirt, they went to sleep very quickly. I sprayed this upon their feast feeling good it was not heavy chemicals. This product is a KEEPER TO KEEP THE CRITTERS AT BAY. Was being consumed by ants due to heat but thanks to the Rescue of this Sawyer Spray KILLS THEM DEAD WITHOUT THE DREAD OF BEING CHEMICAL FED.
customer_reviews.author: E.T. in the crest

customer_reviews.title: Great product but confusing instructions
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great to repel insects. The instructions are confusing. The label instructions and the Helpful Tips and Tricks card provided by Sawyer advise the following. Six ounces are needed to treat an outfit. An outfit is defined as a shirt, trouser and socks. The instructions go on to say that 3 ounces is recommended per garment, that would be 9 ounces per outfit but the instructions indicate that an outfit requires only 6 ounces. Which is it? I use one 24 ounce bottle to treat 4 outfits and have no problems with insects.
customer_reviews.author: BobNC

customer_reviews.title: Not effective enough
customer_reviews.text: We applied it per instruction on all our clothes. People said this stuff creates like a barrier but not for Michigan bugs I guess, I had mosquitoes sitting on my thigh on top of the treated jean. It may have reduced the amount of bugs on us but that's hard to say. We had to spray ourselves with deet anyway so this stuff was waste of money. If it reduces amount of bugs on me from 100 to 10, I'm still getting bitten by that 10 bugs over and over. It has to be 100% effective or it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Choi

customer_reviews.title: Use 3 ounces????
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know if the product works or not. I have no evidence to comment either way. But I can say emphatically that it is impossible to determine the amount you are spraying on a garment without any markings or sight tube on the container......You are guaranteed to spray either too much or too little on the garment. Since it is virtually impossible to use the correct amount...you will never know if the product works or not.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Z.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff kills! :)
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I've used it for many years. I don't camp, but I use this on my general clothing to help with no see ums, and other annoying biting bugs in the Summer. Anything of the bug sort that comes in contact with the material that is treated, just dies. I love it! This time around I only needed 1 container to accomplish my needs. But usually, I'll buy several of these to treat many items. When applying this I always do it outside, I wear disposable gloves to protect my hands, and eye protection in case of wind. Then be sure to soak the item you are treating. Allow to dry completely, then use normally.
customer_reviews.author: BradHip

customer_reviews.title: Works great but have to use a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Works great but I had to use more than expected. Instructions are to spray on exposed area. However I lightly sprayed so that there were small dots about every 2-4 millimeters but not wet. Hungry mosquitos in Africa and Soutjeast Asia were slowed down and better than friends without treatment but still bothersome biting through shirts. My wife made her shirts lightly wet and was much more aggressive with application and was nearly trouble free.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito and fly bites right through my sprayed clothing
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly sprayed my clothing with this before my African trip. My first day in Africa, I sat on my balcony for a few minutes to enjoy the view and then I noticed a large bug crawling up my sleeve. This repellent did not seem to affect it in the least. I later witnessed mosquitoes and tsetse flies biting me right through my clothing. I don’t know if this spray helped in the least. Maybe it would have been worse without it.
customer_reviews.author: JLee

customer_reviews.title: Kills ticks quickly
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why the "rate features" section asks me to rate the flavor of this product. It also asks me to rate the scent, even though it doesn't really have one after you spray an item and allow it to dry before use. Anyway, I went camping in the woods and woke up to the outside of my tent having literally no less than 2000 dead ticks all over it. It killed them very shortly after they came in contact with the tent. I didn't realize the area was so tick-infested, and won't ever camp there again, but never the less I had this preventative on the tent and it worked amazingly!
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Not a single mosquito bite!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a three week trip to Egypt and Kenya. Before leaving I sprayed our shirts, slacks, socks, shoes, hats and bandannas with this spray. Other people in our game preserve did get mosquito bites, but we were not bothered by a single insect. Thus, I can only our bug free trip to this insect repellent. One tip......be sure you use the mist setting to spray .......it goes on quickly, cleanly, dries very quickly. And, the single bottle had enough coverage for ALL our clothes with some left over. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Feels pretty toxic, but it works
customer_reviews.text: You really need a very well-ventilated space to apply this stuff... think outside, 10 yards away from anywhere you might normally like breathing. I wore gloves to apply it, and tried my best to work against the breeze, and it still smelled horrible and I showered immediately after. Basically I followed the instructions and saturated my daughter's camp clothes and let them dry overnight. I was super-paranoid because it is supposedly poisonous to cats, but my kitty lived and my daughter was tick-free for the duration of summer camp. Not looking forward to it, but will definitely be using again.
customer_reviews.author: Amighty

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I love Sawyer insect repellent products for use on skin as well. This product is very effective and relatively easy to use if you follow the detailed instructions. Don't wait until the last minute to treat clothing and gear as it takes time to dry. Beware of potential danger to CATS, not humans or other animals. I am not giving this product 5 stars because the sprayer stopped working mid use. I had to put it in another spray bottle and it was a mess to use. I still have some left unused and would greatly appreciate another spray attachment. Otherwise, I highly recommend using Sawyer Permethrin.
customer_reviews.author: barbara helpin

customer_reviews.title: It works, but...
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the instructions. OK, I understand them, but you have to use a full 3 oz on any given garment from a pair of socks to a jacket. That's just a waste of money treating socks and socks are probably the most important unless you are wearing your pants tucked inside your boots. In SoCal we don't wear clothes like we are going into the woods. We wear shorts with socks and shoes or boots. Yes, we have to use Deet or something organic on the skin, but the right insect deterrent for socks is a must. Won't buy again, but I'm not at all saying it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: zekesays

customer_reviews.title: Great product, really works
customer_reviews.text: I used this while hiking in the White Mountains of New Hampshire, in tandem with Sawyer Picardin Lotion. You spray it on fabric and it works. Mosquitoes, flies and ticks were plentiful and I walked away with not one bite. One of my hike-mates actually commented how the bugs were swarming around me, but not landing. My dog picked up 19 ticks that day, not one migrated to me, even though my pup rode an hour home in the car on my lap. I'm excited to try it out again at an upcoming outdoor music festival, going to spray it on our tent and chairs as well as our clothing.
customer_reviews.author: christine donohue

customer_reviews.title: A friend suggested I pick this up . . . ..
customer_reviews.text: My friend suggested that I purchase this as it supposed to be the best bug repellent available. So I picked some up in preparation for this spring/summer 2020. It will be great to have on hand for bonfire night. Thus we have not had a chance to use this yet, but we will very soon. We live in the country in a very rural area near protected wet lands so we have a lot of bugs at night. Bonfire night is coming very soon and I look forward to this product standing up to its reputation. I'll be back to update this review after putting it to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Motor City Girl

customer_reviews.title: False description - NO sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this listing shows that this is a spray. I got a bottle with a screw on lid - no sprayer. What, am I supposed to pour this on? Very disappointed after waiting for this to arrive. Sure, I can return it, but I ordered this so I would have something to use now. I looked back at the listing's questions & evidently this is a very common issue. It does look like some people did get a sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not a single tick
customer_reviews.text: I used this for scouting and turkey hunting this spring. I put this on my socks, pants, shirt, gator, gloves, and hat, as well as from the knee down on my long underwear. The first day we scouted I did not use this on my clothes and ended up getting multiple ticks. After that I bought this stuff online and sprayed it on everything exposed that I was wearing. After multiple hunts a week for a full season I did not get a single tick on me. Absolutely no scent from this stuff once it was dry. I’ll continue to use this for my hunting and outdoor gear going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Botto

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product now a few times: the jungle coast of Honduras, the mountains there, and in rural Ethiopia. I have sprayed tents, sleeping bags, sheets, and clothes. it works great! Some co-workers were laughing at me when I applied it to my tent. The next morning - zero insect bites. Them? Eaten up. I applied it to their tent secretly that day. They were bowing down to me the next morning. No new bug bites. Just make sure you don't apply it to your skin. Apply it to objects/fabrics with very good air circulation. Let it dry thoroughly before using the items. And test it on one shirt first - occasionally people get an allergic rash.
customer_reviews.author: DL D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for hiking/camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a travel advisor when I was planning a trip to Brazil. Recommended as part of a malaria risk reduction strategy. I've since used it for hiking/camping in the Rockies and on a PCT section hike in the north Cascades. Once garments have been treated and dried I notice no odor, and the treated garments are effective through several washings, rain, etc. Very effective at discouraging mosquitoes and biting flies, and (I assume) ticks. I treated the door of my tent as well and noticed no discoloration or change in performance. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maurer

customer_reviews.title: the product is toxic
customer_reviews.text: I saw a review that said that the product was toxic. It came with a sprayer. I could find no way of using the product without breathing it in. I concluded that the product was more dangerous than the insects it was supposed to repel.
customer_reviews.author: N. E. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Spray nozzle not included.
customer_reviews.text: How did my order of the trigger spray bottle come with out the spray nozzle attachment, now sometimes I would be okay with that except on the back this specifically tells me not to transfer this to another bottle... It just came with that white cap, if this gets rectified I'll change my rating
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ljucovic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because mosquitoes hide behind chairs on my patio. They feel safe in the shade. They normally sit on stucco walls, patio glass door, screen, and back of chairs. Uh.. and I hate them. So, bought this, sprayed all these surfaces. No more mosquitoes. Sometimes, there is one on glass door. This is because the glass door surface always gets wiped out. But, it used to be that if I just move the chairs, there would be 15 - 20 mosquitoes trying to settle. Now, may-be one or none. It has been few weeks since I sprayed. My mosquitoes are from the Costa Mesa California "Nature Preserve" stinky bog.
customer_reviews.author: I.T. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best Permethrin Product IMHO
customer_reviews.text: I have tried / used several premethrin "spray on" products for my outdoor clothing .... Sawyer's is the best in my humble opinion. I am a wildlife photographer and find myself in plenty of places that have ticks, gnats and flies ... Sawyers works great. The information provided states that the product is good for about 6 months or 6 washes and that seems to be about right. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased for boys mission trips down to the Caribean areas, but now use it for repelling mosquitoes and ticks in Michigan. Easy to apply, seems to last through multiple washings once applied to clothing. So far shirt washed 10 times and mosquitoes still won't land on it. Haven't found a tick yet while others in the fishing group are plucking them off after returning to cars. The price is well worth the peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Southern Missouri tick-free!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a week in rural Southern Missouri as part of a mission team constructing a home for a flood victim. I was among the very few that didn't even see a tick anywhere near me for the duration! Prior to packing, I had just enough in one bottle to spray four t-shirts, two pairs of carpenter shorts, a pair of carpenter jeans and a pair of old sneakers. When they dried, they were odor-free and ready to pack. The fact that the repellent stays active after several washings is a plus. Bottom line: I am "bite-free"! Great product! (Bonus tip: stuffing a dryer sheet under your collar repels gnats. Sure, they don't carry disease, but they are SO annoying!)
customer_reviews.author: Commish30

customer_reviews.title: AS A FEW OTHERS HAVE SAID TEST IT BEFORE YOU GET CHEWED UP
customer_reviews.text: I like to walk my dog in a close by wildlife preserve but I can only do in the winter. When the daytime temperature gets above 55 F. The ticks are out in force. I was told by mfg that their product is safe for dogs. So I sprayed him down, rubbed it into his fur, waited for it do dry and took him for a walk on the trails. In under 15 minutes he had 3 tick crawling up one of his front leg.
customer_reviews.author: J. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Spray Bottle, expensive product.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this product is diluted and can be used on clothing. For the high price of this product I would have expected a better spray bottle. The trigger sprayer quit working after about 4 ounces were dispensed and I had to transfer it to a $.99 Walmart spray bottle that works flawlessly. It does smell like insect spray when wet but after it dries it is almost not detectable. No more ticks after treating my socks and jeans cuffs ... I can walk through grass without worrying about the little buggers.
customer_reviews.author: outdoorsgirl

customer_reviews.title: Effective when used correctly!
customer_reviews.text: I treated all of my clothes before a mission trip to Belize. I didn’t want to sleep in DEET! So, I treated my clothes and used Terrashield on my exposed skin. I wasn’t bitten by anything the whole week! The directions say to use 3oz for each clothing item. I laid out what I planned to pack and multiplied times 3 to determine how many bottles I needed. I waited 24 hours after treatment and then washed them so the smell was not as strong.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fussell

customer_reviews.title: Sawyer Products Premium Spray Against Bugs 🕷
customer_reviews.text: The spray is easy to use, but as I figured this out as to why last week I was being eaten alive and this week after spraying a top and a pair of my jeans, not one mosquito 🦟. Well the weather here in North East Arkansas has changed and it’s getting cooler! Lesson learned purchase earlier in spring or summer. So Sadly I don’t know 🤷‍♀️ if it worked or not! Bummer
customer_reviews.author: carolyn b.

customer_reviews.title: It does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to have protection against ticks. The day before our trip I sprayed - literally soaked our clothes - pants, shirts, socks with this product. It was only one day trip to Wisconsin. Next day after returning form our trip we found a tick attached to the skin of my son. I pulled the tick and put it in the sandwich bag and wanted to test premium Insect Repellent sold by Sawyer. I sprayed the tick with this product in closed sandwich bag. Surprisingly it was alive for next 16 minutes. This product does not work as advertised and does not provide any protection against ticks. I'm going to contact Amazon to request refund.
customer_reviews.author: Darek

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work on ticks and paper wasps
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing some field work around my deer blind this spring. So far no ticks crawling up my legs. Sprayed it on my boot and I'm wearing shorts. So, it must be working as described. I also had an issue with paper wasp nesting in my blind. I knocked down the nest, sprayed the area where the nests were and sprayed around the holes they enter. I even hung a pillow case near the entrance area. 2 weeks later and no wasps inside. It obviously is keeping them from re-entering. Haven't tried it on mosquitoes yet. I'll report any problems, but I expect it to work well for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: delump

customer_reviews.title: Do not do fieldwork without it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wildlife biologist and I would not be caught dead without this stuff on my clothes during the field season. This year I've only had a single tick get past this stuff and I've spent the past six months in the woods every single day. For best results, I always freshen up my clothes every time I wash them, but I only wash my gear once a week. If you are going to be in the back country for a long time and can't lug this with you, consider having your clothes professionally treated with Permethrin by a company called Insect Shield which makes your clothes bug free for up to 70 washes.
customer_reviews.author: TBT

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for early season bow hunting. I once had a tick bite with the red ring indicating lyme disease. I have not seen one tick on my person since treating my early season bow gear with this product. Previously I would find one almost every time out. I can't believe deer can't smell it, but I have not been busted in any situation that was not otherwise caused, I believe it to truly be scent free.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Best option to insect repellents when you are in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Best option to insect repellents when you are in the woods. I use it to treat 6 sets of ACU's (military uniforms) for a backpacking trip. We didn't brought any other insect repellent with us for this trip, guess what, no need for it. Bugs didn't bother us the entire weekend. We camped on a heavily ticks infested area (due to deers). No ticks were detected after further inspection of the garments . It is important to follow the manufacturer's instructions to maximize the effectiveness of the product. (the picture shows the treated clothes) The hats were also treated.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowman

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer arrived broken making the product useless until I can find a suitable replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I set the nozzle to the "spray" pattern, squeezed the trigger ... and poison gushed from the trigger housing drenching my hand. I twisted the nozzle 180 degrees and tried again. Same thing... poison gushing all over my hand. I then tried the other 2 sides of the nozzle with the same result. I had to make a trip to the hardware store just to buy a new spray bottle, but it is "too good"... it sprays waaaayyy too much product. So, now I need to find a low volume spray bottle. Until then I have a completely useless product.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho dude

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Do your clothes. Haven't had a tick, mosquitoes fly away. Spray your clothes with it, let 'em dry (good for 6 washes afterward) then if you go out put a little regular repellent on exposed areas, you're set. I have a photography hobby, do extensive outdoor stuff, marsh woods, outside. It plain works great. Been using it since I read a study on ticks by a government agency who used this. I Tried it, they were right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Product that Works
customer_reviews.text: After having suffered for days from chigger bites that I got when clearing brush from my coastal Georgia property, I ordered this Sawyer product and applied it exactly as specified on the instructions before my next trip back into that same area 3 weeks later. Zero bites and no ticks after a full day's work. Tucking trouser cuffs into boot socks that had been treated with Sawyers' Permethrin, as had the rest of my work clothing, made a huge difference. On the few areas of exposed skin I used Sawyer's Picaridin, and I am convinced that this gave me all around protection from biting critters.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Never have a tick embed again.
customer_reviews.text: This is marketed as a repellent, which I feel is slightly misleading. Perhaps it does repel to some degree, but the reason to use it is that when an arthropod comes into contact with a treated item, it dies shortly after. If you may guess this is extremely useful for tick-heavy areas. I used this for a summer job in which I worked for a lab - out in the field collecting ticks for research, actually seeking them out. Did not have a single tick embed itself all summer. Lyme disease is serious stuff, think of this as a vaccine for Lyme, and who wants to find a tick in their armpit anyways?
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: It helps!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this a few times for my backpacking trips. I hate biting bugs and this has kept them off my clothes. No mosquitoes/flies this time biting through my clothes. Just wished it would keep them from going after my exposed skin! Can’t speak to ticks since I didn’t hike where ticks where. I like the fact that my clothes don’t have a chemical odor after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Momtoboys4

customer_reviews.title: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! SPRAY EVERYTHING!!
customer_reviews.text: It was my first time traveling to Brazil and I was scared straight about yellow fever, so I did exactly what my travel doc told me and purchased this. I sprayed every piece of clothing that I was taking on the trip a week or so prior to give ample amount of time to air dry. There’s a mild scent initially, but after the air dry you don’t smell anything. I coupled this with Ultrathon Insect Repellent Lotion, 34% Deet. This combination saved me. I didn’t get bit one time the entire 2 weeks I was there.
customer_reviews.author: Arie T.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, just be careful with application.
customer_reviews.text: We have several types of ticks in our area (mid west) from deer/dog ticks to the lone star tick. Mosquitos and chiggers and also anoying insects we have to deal with. I applied this to a pair of both mine and my fiance's socks and Hiking boots and let them dry. We both immediately noticed a reduction in ticks and chigger bites so it absolutely works. Of course you have to be careful with this stuff because while it is wet it is a neurotoxin, which is why it works so well. Just wear gloves, don't breath it in, and let it dry %100 before messing with your gear and it will work fantasticly.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: SMELLS TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Putting aside the effectiveness of this product, it says on the bottle that there is no smell. It smelled so noxious that I could not use this product again. In addition, it doesn't spray lightly. It sprays heavily and soaks large splotches onto your clothing. I had to wait an hour to wear my clothing because I was afraid to get my skin wet with this noxious-smelling chemical. I will go back to the other brand that I tried which had no smell and did not leave soaked marks on my clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Must have to enjoy the outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I am very allergic to mosquitoes, and have traveled to India several times. Using this product exactly per its directions turned out worry free for me. I laid out out my travel clothes in the open air and sprayed it in groups at a time such as pants, tops, socks, etc. I included my shoes, hats, scarves, backpack and so one. I then left everything out to dry and to air out completely for a day or two. There is no smell and mosquitoes stayed away. Since then I have sprayed my daily jackets and sweaters I wear when gathering with family and friends to enjoy the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: TonyF

customer_reviews.title: The BEST For Warding Off Ticks
customer_reviews.text: I've been using permethrin since at least 2006, including during my 2007 thru-hike of the Appalachian Trail. Permethrin on your hiking gear, combined with DEET on your clothes, is the BEST solution for warding off ticks, plus mosquitoes, other bugs, etc. One caution. CAREFULLY follow the directions. Apply it in a well ventilated space, like a garage with the door open. Allow your clothes to dry completely before you put them on. NEVER put permethrin in liquid form on your skin. But, after it dries completely it is harmless to humans and deadly to ticks.
customer_reviews.author: jimhfoster

customer_reviews.title: It smells like turpentine.
customer_reviews.text: It went under the sink with other chemicals. It smells like turpentine. It says to spray it on clothes and such, in all honesty, I would never spray this on anything I own as it smells like I'd then become flammable or I'd lose more brain cells than I already have. We bought this for a trip that it was needed to coat sleeping bags and clothes, we didn't even both taking it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek D. Bergey

customer_reviews.title: Works great (until it doesn't)
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning a trip and pretreated your clothes, make sure you estimated correctly the amount of washes/time it is going to last. My experience suggests that it is somewhat less than indicated in the product description. I used it in the field and I had a bunch of thin synthetic pants and shirts which I pretreated. When this repellent stopped working into the third week of a particularly rainy field season in Guatemala, I suddenly realized it was the only thing that kept the mosquitoes from biting through those shirts and pants!
customer_reviews.author: Alex T

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Permethrin Insect Repellent WORKS for clothing and footwear; I haven't needed it for anything else yet. There are a lot of ticks here, and I have had none on me this year. Application is easy. Wearing rubber gloves, I sprayed everything I anticipated needing, including shoes and gardening gloves, outside on a day with no wind, and hung them on the clotheslines to dry. These garments won't need to be retreated for several washings. I'm so happy not to have to spray myself with insect repellent every time I go into my yard this year!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising
customer_reviews.text: My first review was rejected, apparently since I complained that the product did not come with a spray pump as shown. So even though all the reviews that complained about a faulty spray nozzle were published, the LACK of a spray nozzle is prohibited by the rules. So let me talk about the product itself. It is really, really awful.
customer_reviews.author: Kim P.

customer_reviews.title: plunger needs stronger return spring but product works well,
customer_reviews.text: We have used Sawyer's for years. It works great. We thought the spray was a better buy then the aerosol and it probably is. However the plunger under the trigger needs a stronger return and you must wait for the plunger to return between each individual spray making it awkward to use. The only reason for a 3 star overall is the ease of use
customer_reviews.author: DougK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results in our building!
customer_reviews.text: We had tons of Californian mosquitoes all over the corridor and hall to our apartment. Eventually they were able to sneak in our home and have a mosquito party night. We applied this to the wall and ceiling corners, and around the frame in the home's door. Amazing results, mosquitoes are gone!! No scent, no marks. I don't know yet how long it will last, but after 3 days they have not come back yet! Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Borja

customer_reviews.title: It worked well in Alaska
customer_reviews.text: We visited Denali National Park in early July and camped at Wonder Lake campground for 2 nights. We treated our clothes, socks, hats, and the entrance of our tent with permethrin. Even though there were enough mosquitoes that we had to wear a mosquito head net, I did not see any mosquitoes on our clothes. It also prevented them to enter into our tent as well. If you are planing on going to mosquito infested areas, I highly recommend treating your clothes with permethrin.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! If your an outdoors kind of person this is a must have. When I use as directed I haven’t had any problems hiking or on my walks around the lake edge. I’ve been free of bugs biting or stinging me. It is also fantastic for spraying areas where ants or other bugs are coming into your house. I open my doors in the spring and spray all around the door edges and the door frame. No more bugs coming into my house any more.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: No Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this specifically to spray all of our camping clothes. This was supposed to come with a sprayer but it came with a flat screw cap lid. That makes it difficult to be able to use... so I can't speak to its effectiveness at this time. I'll update if I ever get a sprayer to be able to use it. If not, I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shingler

customer_reviews.title: Tick Preventer
customer_reviews.text: While wearing pants that were treated with Sawyer's Permethrin in a heavily populated tick area I saw a tick on my shoe. The shoes had not been treated. The tick moved over to the bottom of my pants which have been treated. It reared up it's front legs, turned, and fell off my shoe. I was hiking with someone without permethrin on her clothes and several ticks got on her. When I got home I sprayed my shoes. This product works!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great for high mosquito areas even after several washes
customer_reviews.text: I went to 2 countries in Africa and my Dr recommended these for me, as both countries I traveled to are prone to mosquitos at night. The smell is strong, but I didn't get bit for the duration of my stay. My favorite part is that I washed my clothes several times, and didn't get bit and didn't have to re- spray.
customer_reviews.author: aea0060

customer_reviews.title: ZERO TICKS
customer_reviews.text: We have used Sawyer for 5 years now. In the Spring we hunt "Morel Mushrooms". The first day out this year; we did not have our clothes sprayed. We both came home with ticks not only still crawling but some attached for a permanent home. We took our outfits and hung them on the clothesline. Completely sprayed them with Sawyer and left them hang on the line all day. We wore those outfits for the following 3 weeks and never got a tick. You are able to wash the clothes and the spray protectant still works through approximately 6 washings. We also use it during hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good product, lousy sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Good product, lousy sprayer. Enough to treat 2 pairs of pants, two pull overs, and two hats. That is except for the product that dribbles to the floor from the nozzle, almost enough to treat another piece of clothing. Quite a waste. That said, expect the black flies, mosquito and ticks to be minimal with the treatment. UPDATE: Complaints about the sprayer aside, the product works wonders at repelling biting insects. It was black fly/Mosquito season in the mountains, and they would land and immediately leave the treated fabric. Saw no ticks, but that's normal where we were. Very pleased changed my review to 4 stars, fix the sprayer and 5 stars are yours !
customer_reviews.author: Sir Not Appearing in this Picture.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product and a Must Have for Camping
customer_reviews.text: We had our fall campout at Camp Wisdom for cub scouts this year and I purchased this product to protect our tent and belongings from invaders. It was very easy to use and worked amazing. I used almost the entire bottle, so I will purchase a few more bottles to have on hand for future camping adventures. I was skeptical that it would work, but it really does. We did not have any bugs or insects enter our tent the entire trip. After the heavy rains in Dallas recently we knew mosquitos would be out heavy so I wanted to ensure we protected not only ourselves, but the equipment. Buy it today! You will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Happy In Texas

customer_reviews.title: Sawyer products are the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: go ahead, Google it... better yet, Youtube it... you won't find a single bad review, and there is a reason for it (its the best in every way). i've purchased them for myself, and family members, and they liked it so much, they bought more for their whole family. not only does it work, but... it doesn't ruin you tent / clothing (or any kind of fabric) like products with DEET in them.. don't second guess if you should buy it or not, just get it, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye ticks!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing!!! Recently bought an overgrown ranch and each time we would go out of cad we would be covered in ticks. One time I had over 30 on my feet and ankles. We would spray but never worked. We decided to give this a try and what a miracle it is!! We have never had a tick bite us while wearing clothing treated. We have seen 2 dead ones on jeans but that's it. I was cautious because I am not a chemical fan but the ticks left me no choice. Love this stuff!!!
customer_reviews.author: BandJ

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: Live in a rural woods setting. Love the peacefulness and the beauty but hate tick and chigger season. This product amazed me. When working in garden ticks were bad. Used this product and and no problem. I was amazed. My husband was walking a wooded area neighbor just bought and was clearing. Without this product had at least 15 ticks, with this product none! It really works. Definitely recommend to all who live in wooded areas where ticks and chiggers are a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tobitha

customer_reviews.title: Terrible spray nozzle
customer_reviews.text: I spray my clothes before going into the woods to keep ticks from getting on me. Permethrin is very effective against ticks. But this particular sprayer is impossible. It sprays a perfect circle. Everything goes to the edge of the circle and nothing goes inside. It is impossible to get an even distribution of the repellant. You just get a lot of wet circles. I bought the same chemical compound in another sprayer and plan to pour this product into the new sprayer when it needs replenishment.
customer_reviews.author: lou

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer Broke After 1 Use
customer_reviews.text: I treated a work shirt, pair of jeans and socks before I started clearing some land. Product worked well, no ticks in a location where I had gotten them before. But when I need to re-apply after 6 weeks, the sprayer broke after just a few sprays. Sawyer calls this a "premium" product and it has a "premium" price. Wish they'd spent a few more cents and got a quality spray bottle. I'm not really comfortable pouring pesticide into another container, so I guess I lost the rest of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE MCHOLLAN

customer_reviews.title: I think it works! Bed bugs or ticks gone.
customer_reviews.text: I had kinda bug bites on my legs and it didn’t seems to go away for a while. So, I think it must be something on my bed, either bed bugs or ticks because my dogs get on the bed sometimes. So, I decided to try this product. After sprayed generous amount all over my bed and pillows ( I have a king size bed and about 1/3 of bottle are gone) then leave it air-dry for 8 hours. I didn’t have a bites on my legs and arms since then. It’s been about 2.5 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: BEGONE TICKS!
customer_reviews.text: Without treated clothing I had 6 ticks on me in 20 minutes walking through the grass. After the same clothes were treated I got 0 ticks from laying in the same tall grass for hours while hunting. Permethrin makes the ticks wig out and fall off. This stuff works just follow the instructions. I even use it on the dog which works well too.
customer_reviews.author: keith naulty

customer_reviews.title: When your life might cross with a bug’s life....
customer_reviews.text: Going to places with Zika virus? Camping? Europe trip? Amazon? Going to bird watching with tons of insect? Best to spray your clothes and hat. Better than buying those clothing with insect repellent because all those clothing wear out sometime but you don’t know when! Because I know my kid will not remember/bother to put on any insect repellent. Spray the clothing before your trip and you are set.
customer_reviews.author: O. P.

customer_reviews.title: Bugs by gone
customer_reviews.text: I I found this somewhat difficult to spray. I wish they would have made the neck longer to make this easier. I used the product off label when our dog was diagnosed with scabies and we were itching too. I would really like to believe it helped to conquer our issue by spraying the matresses and furniture once a week. The size of this bottle means it lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lee Craun

customer_reviews.title: Not 100%
customer_reviews.text: Treated two pairs of pants and two shirts per the instructions on Wednesday. War one outfit yesterday and pulled two tix off of my lower pant leg while in the field. That said, the terrain I was in, tall grass most of the way, I would have expected to normally attract more texts than two
customer_reviews.author: J Gray

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful when applying this product
customer_reviews.text: Two things be careful with: first it comes in a container that does not have an inner seal. If the bottle cap was to come loose in shipment it could potentially contaminate humans and other packages. Second be careful when spraying the product as a slight breeze can blow the product back into your face and eyes. Please use a face mask and gloves when applying. The product is loaded with pre-cautions. Be sure to read the directions well.
customer_reviews.author: Kodydog

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not cheap
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but they don't advertise how much of it you have to use to really protect your clothing. If you follow directions, one whole bottle only protects a few articles of clothing. You have to really soak stuff apparently to make it work. It does repel ticks and fleas, etc., but it's pretty expensive if you have to use it on a lot of things. It doesn't last forever either, so cost can be significant. But, again, it does repel/kill fleas and ticks.
customer_reviews.author: DKCDKC

customer_reviews.title: Effective against Ticks!  And Mosquitoes.  And Flies.
customer_reviews.text: If you live in an area with ticks, choose one: 1) Permethrin 2) Lyme Disease This stuff works, but READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. It is a clothing pre-treatment that MUST DRY before you wear the clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K. Walker

customer_reviews.title: No bugs since using this spray as preventative measure
customer_reviews.text: I love how it prevents ants and spiders from entering my home. I spray all around the doorway and windows. I havent had any issues with bugs for at least 3 years now (but my duplex neighbors do!). I faithfully spray once to twice a year and that's it. I also spray my patio umbrella, chairs and table once a summer. It works wonderfully! No odor to it. It is safe for pets etc...AFTER it is dry. You can also spray down tents and clothing. Doesn't stain.
customer_reviews.author: DBlanchette

customer_reviews.title: Toxic to Cats!!
customer_reviews.text: We didn't realize this was extremely toxic to cats so are unable to use it since we have cats and would never use a product that could be harmful in any way to any animals. Currently don't know what to do with the bottle; perhaps find someone who can use it safely or attempt to return but returns are such an expensive pain in the behind.
customer_reviews.author: Cam2

customer_reviews.title: ... this and treating clothes on your own is the best, most cost-effective way to get Permethrin treated clothing
customer_reviews.text: Getting this and treating clothes on your own is the best, most cost-effective way to get Permethrin treated clothing. It doesn't make sense to buy overpriced, pre-treated clothing when you could just quickly spray down most of your clothing with this bottle. Beware, they do NOT keep mosquitos away, but are good for ticks and chiggers because they effectively kill them. So socks are a great thing to spray down with this
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Best Bug Deterrent
customer_reviews.text: Never spray your skin! This is for applying to your clothing, letting it dry and then wearing. I have designated gardening clothes so no worry of any staining, which I have never noticed anyway. A must have if you want to venture beyond the grass. I make sure to spray my pant legs/cuffs and my shirt collar and my hat. This is a permethrin product - while 'natural' keep in mind that too much of anything is toxic to you.
customer_reviews.author: Esme

customer_reviews.title: Good bug repellent!
customer_reviews.text: We followed manufacturer instructions and applied this to all of our clothing and suitcases before our one month trip to South America. It has a really strong scent during application, much like waterproofing spray, but it completely fades away once it dries. We had no issues with getting bit through our clothes so I guess it worked! And no bugs in our suitcases either! I liked that I didn't have to put this on my skin. 1 bottle worked for carry-on suitcase, clothes, hats, umbrella and shoes for one week.
customer_reviews.author: love2bamom

customer_reviews.title: LEARN!
customer_reviews.text: Better than a Band Aid. We go camping and fishing. My camping buddy refused to use this spray on her clothes. She got bit by spiders, ticks and mosquitoes so bad she had to go to the hospital. I didn't have not ONE bite. I also use Repel on my exposed skin . LEARN!
customer_reviews.author: free10661

customer_reviews.title: Actually does not include a non-aerosol pump bottle
customer_reviews.text: The product description clearly states the product is a "non-aerosol pump bottle", however, no non-aerosol pump is included with the product, just the capped bottle. You will need to purchase a separate pump and bottle, and transfer the product to that to use. I don't appreciate bait-and-switch products that do not arrive as advertised. I'll be returning the product for a refund and purchasing a competitors offering.
customer_reviews.author: vettenet

customer_reviews.title: Skin saver!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! We bought on recommendation of our travel nurse for a rain forest trip. I didn’t apply bug repellent to my skin and got NO bites. I applied to a pair of Adidas pants and it didn’t affect the fabric or discolor the pants. We started to buy to use for the summer months at the lake for bonfire nights instead of putting on all the bug spray. Now we just put on our pretreated clothes and we don’t need all the deet and Off on our skin!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine W.

customer_reviews.title: An urban dog walker weighs in on Permethrin Clothing Insect Repellent
customer_reviews.text: I do not camp but speaking as someone who walks their dog in a neighborhood in an urban area, I am still leery of bugs. I appreciate that part of nature but from afar, very far. This was easy to spray on shoes, a hat and a bandanna. It dries pretty quickly and leaves no trace of smell or feel. I also saw not change in color to any of the items on which I sprayed this product. I can't speak as someone who would use it camping or hiking but for what I need, I think this works well. It does say keep away from cats so make sure you read that part if you have any kitties.
customer_reviews.author: WestGhent

customer_reviews.title: Vital part missing
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the product i received did not have the pump sprayer included with the repellent bottle. This product was recommended by a passport travel agency we used to give us yellow fever shots. We believe the product will be useful around home for repelling mosquitoes, etc. once we get a container with a sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: VeggieMan

customer_reviews.title: BACKPACKER ESSENTIAL
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product I've found for backpack preparation! I've used this brand for about five years. It works the best! I spray down my backpacks, tents, clothing, hats and mattresses once every summer. It keeps me mosquito and tick free! I never have a problem with the bugs! Canadian and Sierra lakes or snow covered areas! I lay all my gear in the back yard and spray down thoroughly. It drys in about four hours.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Girl

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Have used this several times and works just as stated (actually on my second bottle). Have primarily used it to spray down my backpacking gear before heading into the Shenandoah's with the primary intention of avoiding ticks. It is very effective. I actually watched a few bugs that were hanging out on the tent slowly pass away. No scent that I noticed (no chemical bug spray scent). Just follow the manufactures directions and you should be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Say Good Bye  to Ticks & Chiggers
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I live in an area where ticks and chiggers are prevalent. After application of the Permethrin on my clothing, and spending 8 to 10 hours working in the woods ticks and chiggers became history. At the end of each working day it was fantastic to see absolutely zero tick or chigger bites. SGh Hogg Fed Àja Hfffg Dog D Sajhhff God FdAJj G GfSJhhg Fog LdHflskjfahffD
customer_reviews.author: RCC

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad function
customer_reviews.text: The permethrin does its job as expected. Sawyer needs to improve the pump sprayer immensely. Out of 4 Ive purchased 3 had the pump sprayer fail within about 30 seconds of use. Why amazon asks to rate the "Flavor" is bizarre. Do Not Eat or Taste the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sensor

customer_reviews.title: NO TICKS
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed on my clothes as described and man what a difference. I didn't even have to spray off on my bare skin it worked so well. Our cabin is in a tick infected area. I was literally crawling on the ground for 45 minutes looking for a few parts I dropped in the tall grass/ferns in our woods. Normally just walking though I would get 2 to 3 ticks. I had none all weekend and spent the entire time in the deep ferns and grass. Best stuff ever...
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful spraying it on your dog. My dog had a reaction.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this on hiking clothes. But after seeing on the sawyer website that you can use it on your dog, I gave it a try. First I tried on his paws And legs, my dog’s skin seemed to tolerate it just fine. After two weeks I tried on the rest of his body. Big mistake. It seemed to have triggered a flare up of dermatitis. Poor doggie can’t go on hikes until his skin returns to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Gamgee

customer_reviews.title: Kills ticks on your clothing
customer_reviews.text: If you want to avoid getting ticks, you need this. It doesn’t just repel the ticks, it kills them. You can spray it on your hat, your socks, your shoes, your clothing, and your tent. Just keep it off your skin and away from your cat! Permethrin is toxic to cats.
customer_reviews.author: Estella

customer_reviews.title: Tick Be Gone
customer_reviews.text: Great product, came on time, no problems with ordering, and will order again if needed. Would I recommend this seller and product? YES - ALSO I didn't smell it but when it did get sprayed, there wasn't any over powering smell. But the FAVOR that just confused me LOL
customer_reviews.author: DebraKay

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy anything else A+++++
customer_reviews.text: Really works! Finally something that truly works. I often worry about using things like this because of chemicals. It says spray on clothes not skin so I wonder about health issues with long term use BUT Lyme disease no laughing matter.., very serious and life long problems. Ticks are the worst.., so that needs to be taken into consideration. I will happily use this to avoid ticks and disease.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: BUGS OFF!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm both a geocacher and hiker. Often have to bushwack through insect ridden foliage both down in Florida and up in Ontario. Spray 2 outfits with this stuff and lasts thru' many washings, especially if you don't wash after every outing. This is an effective product on possible Lyme disease carrying ticks as well as mosquitos, black flies and horse flies. Safe around kids & food. This product was developed for the military in far away places. Always protect yourself!
customer_reviews.author: ARLMAR

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This product is 100% effective Iv'e washed my clothes 4 times and tick repellent still effective as first applicating. I'm in the woods for hours mushroom hunting and this is the 4th year using this product and not one tick or mosquito bite. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: a** clown

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Just Works!
customer_reviews.text: Product does what it says and is highly effective. I tested it amongst the massive swarms of mosquitos and cockroaches in Texas, Arkansas and Mississippi as well the seriously dangerous critters in up-country Kenya. The results was always the ...mosquitoes, roaches and other insects 🕷 🦟 were killed on contact. I sprayed windowsills, thresholds and vents. It acted like a deadline that no others crossed, else they were doomed also!
customer_reviews.author: Living & Loving Port Hueneme!

customer_reviews.title: Time tested
customer_reviews.text: Real good stuff. Spray it on everything that goes camping or hiking. This is already mixed to the right percentage. I spray my BDU pants, hat, shirt and fold everything up BEFORE going out. Including tent or bivy. That way they’re ready when I am.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah, .... right

product_meta.title: Sawyer Products Premium Permethrin Insect Repellent for Clothing, Gear & Tents
feature_bullets: Effective against the Yellow Fever Mosquito which can transmit the Zika Virus
Lasts up to 6 weeks (or 6 washings); will not stain or damage clothing, fabrics, plastics, finished surfaces, or outdoor gear
Odorless after drying; ideal for use while hunting
24-ounce capacity treats up to 8 garments; non-aerosol pump bottle; color of bottle may vary
Insect-killing repellent for your clothing is effective against ticks, chiggers, mites and mosquitoes including the Zika-transmitting Yellow Fever Mosquito; as effective as 100 percent DEET

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
